member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics.FileList

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics.Threads

member.name: T:ComponentPro.IO.FileContentComparer
member.summary: Represents file content comparer.
member.remarks: This compares content of multiple files at the same time on-the-fly without retriving the whole file content. When it detects a difference or EOF is reached, the comparison of a file is complete.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode
member.summary: Specifies actions to resolve file existing issue.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode.Confirm
member.summary: Raise the event to confirm next action on an existing file. By handling the event, the program can let user decide whether to overwrite the existing files.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode.Skip
member.summary: Skip existing files.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode.Overwrite
member.summary: Overwrite existing files without confirmation.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode.OverwriteOlderFiles
member.summary: Overwrite existing files without confirmation if they are older than source files. If the File System is SFTP or FTP, using this mode is not recommended because modification dates are often misreported by FTP and SFTP servers, making this mode unreliable. We strongly recommend to use the mode and set the property to a file comparer or develop a custom solution by handling the event. Make sure your system time is synchronized with the destination file system/server. If the source or destination file system is and the time differs (e.g. different timezone), specify a timezone offset in the property.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode.OverwriteNewerFiles
member.summary: Overwrite existing files without confirmation if they are newer than source files. If the File System is SFTP or FTP, using this mode is not recommended because modification dates are often misreported by FTP and SFTP servers, making this mode unreliable. We strongly recommend to use the mode and set the property to a file comparer or develop a custom solution by handling the event. Make sure your system time is synchronized with the destination file system/server. If the source or destination file system is and the time differs (e.g. different timezone), specify a timezone offset in the property.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode.OverwriteFilesWithDifferentLastModifiedTime
member.summary: Overwrite existing files without confirmation if they are newer or older than source files. If the File System is SFTP or FTP, using this mode is not recommended because modification dates are often misreported by FTP and SFTP servers, making this mode unreliable. We strongly recommend to use the mode and set the property to a file comparer or develop a custom solution by handling the event. Make sure your system time is synchronized with the destination file system/server. If the source or destination file system is and the time differs (e.g. different timezone), specify a timezone offset in the property.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode.OverwriteFilesWithDifferentSizes
member.summary: Overwrite existing files with different sizes. The destination file will be overwritten without confirmation if it is different to the source file in length.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode.OverwriteFilesWithDifferentChecksums
member.summary: Overwrite existing files with different checksums. The destination file will be overwritten without confirmation if its checksum is different to the source file's.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode.CustomCompare
member.summary: Use to compare source and destination files. If the return value of the method indicate that the source and destination files are equal, the existing will be skipped; otherwise, it will be overwritten.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode.ResumeFileTransfer
member.summary: Resume file transfer. Not available in file move mode. If the destination file size is less than the source file size, the component will resume file transfer. If there is no difference in file length, the destination file wont be overwritten. If the destination file size is greater than the source file size, the destination file will be overwritten.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileOverwriteMode.Rename
member.summary: Use a different name for an existing file. New name is generated from the current item according the pattern specified in ("filename[number].extension" by default).

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.NormalizePath(System.String)
member.summary: Normalizes a path. This method normalizes path like "\my folder\\my sub folder/sub folder/\my file" to "/my folder/my sub folder/sub folder/my file" if directory separator character is '/'.
member.param: The path to normalize.
member.returns: Normalized path.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.NormalizePath(System.String,System.Boolean,ComponentPro.OptionValue,ComponentPro.OptionValue)
member.summary: Normalizes a path. This method normalizes path like "\my folder\\my sub folder/sub folder/\my file" to "/my folder/my sub folder/sub folder/my file" if directory separator character is '/'.
member.param: The path to normalize.
A boolean value indicating whether to normalize special directories like '.' and '..' found in the path. It treats '.' dir as the current directory and '..' as the upper directory.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the end of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the ending separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the last character as it is.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the beginning of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the leading separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the first character as it is.
member.returns: Normalized path.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.NormalizePath(System.String,System.Char[],System.Boolean,ComponentPro.OptionValue,ComponentPro.OptionValue)
member.summary: Normalizes a path. This method normalizes path like "\my folder\\my sub folder/sub folder/\my file" to "/my folder/my sub folder/sub folder/my file" if directory separator characters are '/' and '\' respectively.
member.param: The path to normalize.

The path separator characters (e.g. '/' and '\' characters). The first separator in the list will be used to construct the final path. Remote file systems (e.g. Ftp, Sftp, Scp, etc.) usually use '/' character as the first separator.
A boolean value indicating whether to normalize special directories like '.' and '..' found in the path. It treats '.' dir as the current directory and '..' as the upper directory.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the end of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the ending separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the last character as it is.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the beginning of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the leading separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the first character as it is.
member.returns: Normalized path.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.DeleteDirectory(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the specified directory and, if indicated, any subdirectories and files in the directory.
member.param: The path and name of the directory to remove. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are deleted. For example, if ""(empty string) is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be deleted. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the .TXT extension will be deleted. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, or VB extension in "/mydir" will be deleted. If no masks specified, the whole content of the specified directory should be deleted. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
true to remove directories, subdirectories, and files in path; otherwise, false.

remarks.p: Empty directories are to be removed. This method does not build directory hierarchy before deleting items.
For more advanced files and directories deletion, use the methods.

member.returns: The statistics of the multi-file operation.
member.exception: is a null reference (Nothing in VB.NET).
contains illegal path characters.
An error occurred while deleting the directory.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.Delete(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition)
member.summary: Deletes files or directories and, if indicated, any subdirectories matching the specified search condition on the list.
member.param: List of files and directories to remove. This list can contain and objects. (e.g. (new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" }...) or (new object[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }...)) This parameter cannot be null or empty.
true to remove subdirectories, and files in path; otherwise, false to remove files in the first level directory only.
true to remove empty directories; otherwise, false.
The search conditions to match against the files, or a null reference to search for all files.
member.returns: A that contains the statistics of the operation and list of processed files and directories.
member.remarks: This method does not build directory hierarchy before deleting items.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.Delete(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition)
member.summary: Deletes files and directories matching the specified search condition in the specified directory. This method only deletes the items in the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To remove the whole directory, you should add a directory separator character at the end of that parameter.
member.param: The path and name of the directory containing contents to remove. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are deleted. For example, if ""(empty string) is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be deleted. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the .TXT extension will be deleted. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, or VB extension in "/mydir" will be deleted. If no masks specified, files and subdirectories in the specified directory should be deleted. The final search condition is a combination of the masks, if found, in the and the parameters. If this value ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the containing directory will also be removed. For example, if "/folder/" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" folder and itself will be removed. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
true to remove subdirectories, and files in path; otherwise, false to remove files in the first level directory only.
true to remove empty directories; otherwise, false.
The search conditions to match against the files, or a null reference to search for all files.
member.returns: A that contains the statistics of the operation and list of processed files and directories.
member.remarks: Empty directories are to be removed. This method does not build directory hierarchy before deleting items.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.Delete(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition)
member.summary: Deletes files matching the specified search condition in the specified directory. This method only deletes the items in the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To remove the whole directory, you should add a directory separator character at the end of that parameter.
member.param: The path and name of the directory containing contents to remove. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are deleted. For example, if ""(empty string) is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be deleted. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the .TXT extension will be deleted. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, or VB extension in "/mydir" will be deleted. If no masks specified, files and subdirectories in the specified directory should be deleted. The final search condition is a combination of the masks, if found, in the and the parameters. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory in the parameter should also be deleted. For example: ("/MyDir/*.txt", ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is also deleted if this folder is empty after all ".txt" files within "MyDir" have been deleted; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not included in the deletion process.

List of files and directories to remove. This list may contain and objects. (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 })
true to build directory hierarchy to show progress of the entire operation before deleting; otherwise, false.
true to remove subdirectories, and files in path; otherwise, false to remove files in the first level directory only.
true to remove empty directories; otherwise, false.
The search conditions to match against the files, or a null reference to search for all files.
member.returns: A that contains the statistics of the operation and list of processed files and directories.

If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, or VB extension in "/mydir" will be deleted. If no masks specified, files and subdirectories in the specified directory should be deleted. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. If this value ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the containing directory is to be removed. For example, if "/folder/" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" folder and itself are removed. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

For example: ("/MyDir/*.txt", ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is also deleted if this folder is empty after all ".txt" files within "MyDir" have been deleted; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not included in the deletion process.
The delete options.

List of files and directories to remove. This optional list can contain and objects. (e.g. ("", false, new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" }...) or ("", false, new object[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }...)).
true to remove empty directories; otherwise, false.
member.returns: A that contains the statistics of the operation and list of processed files and directories.

member.param: The base directory to search for files and directories to remove or null when is specified and a base path for the list is not needed.

Indicates whether the containing directory in the parameter should also be deleted. For example: DeleteAsync("/MyDir/*.txt", ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is also deleted if this folder is empty after all ".txt" files within "MyDir" have been deleted; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not included in the deletion process.
List of files and directories to remove. This list must comprise file paths in and/or instances.

members.member:
Moves files that match the search condition specified in the parameter from the specified directory to the destination directory using multiple threads. This method only moves the items of the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To move the whole directory, use the method instead.
The path of the directory containing files and subdirectories to move. If it is empty, the current directory path of the file system is used. When the parameter is a null reference, this can contain wildcard masks. For example, "/myremotedir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" means all .dat, .cs, and .vb files in '/myremotedir' will be moved, "/myremotedir" means all files in '/myremotedir' will be moved. For more details, see and the option . The list of file names or objects containing information of files to move (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }), or a null reference to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the options parameter. If this value ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the containing directory will also be moved. For example, if "/folder/" is used, files and subdirectories of "folder" directory and itself will be moved; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. The path of the destination directory. The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process. The number of concurrent threads used to transfer/move files, or 0 to transfer/move files in single-thread mode. A boolean value indicating whether the method will block the execution until all threads have finished. This parameter is only used when the parameter is greater than 0. A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.Move(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves files on the list that match the search condition specified in the parameter to the destination directory using multiple threads. This method only moves the items of the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To move the whole directory, use the method instead.
member.param: The list of file names or objects containing information of files to move. (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 })
The path of the destination directory.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method blocks the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method immediately returns the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.MoveAsync(System.String,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously moves files that match the search condition specified in the options parameter from the specified directory to the destination directory on this file system. This method only moves the items of the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To move the whole directory, use the method instead.
member.param: The path of the directory containing files and subdirectories to move. When the parameter is a null reference, this can contain wildcard masks. For example, "/myremotedir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" means all .dat, .cs, and .vb files in '/myremotedir' will be moved, "/myremotedir" means all files in '/myremotedir' will be moved. For more details, see and the option .

The list of files and directories to move, or a null reference to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This list must comprise file paths in and/or instances. (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }) If this value ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the containing directory will also be moved. For example, if "/folder/" is used, files and subdirectories of "folder" directory and itself will be moved; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents.
The path of the destination directory.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An object that references the asynchronous operation.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.TransferConfirm
member.summary: Occurs when the file system has detected an issue while transferring files such as existing file found, symlink detected or an error encountered.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.UniqueId
member.summary: Gets the unique object id.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.ThreadId
member.summary: Gets the thread id.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.DirectorySeparators
member.summary: Gets an array containing the characters that are directory separators.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.InvalidPathChars
member.summary: Gets an array containing the characters that are not allowed in path names.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.InvalidFileNameChars
member.summary: Gets or sets an array containing the characters that are not allowed in file or directory names, or null if this file system accepts all characters in file name.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.InvalidFileNameCharsSubstitution
member.summary: Gets or sets the substitution character that will replace the invalid characters found in file or directory name while copying files from another file system.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.FileSystemFeatures
member.summary: Gets the supported features.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.InvokeFromCurrentThreads
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to raise events from the current thread or to use a object available when an asynchronous operation was started. The default value is false.
member.value: true to raise events directly from the current working thread; false to raise them using a object.
member.remarks: Synchronous methods always raise events from the current working thread.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.Progress
member.summary: Occurs when a block of data is transferred, or a file operation is being or has been executed.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.ThreadStateChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the state of the thread is changed while in a multi-thread file transfer.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.FileInfoPartsToGetBeforeTransferring
member.summary: Specifies which information of the source file will be obtained before transferring.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.ProgressInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the interval in milliseconds between the events fired during transfer. The default value is 100 ms.
member.remarks: If set to zero(0), the event is fired for every data block transferred. In GUI applications, displaying a progress bar and messages too many times may affect the application performance. Increase this property to avoid that.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.ServerTimeZoneOffset
member.summary: This value is used to synchronize the CreationTime and LastWriteTime of files after a transfer. The default value is TimeSpan.Zero.
member.remarks: When a file is copied from this file system to another one and the option is enabled, the file's and will be added with this value. Likewise, and of a file that is copied from another file system will be subtracted from this value.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.RestoreFileProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to restore file properties including and after downloading or uploading if possible.
member.remarks: Use the to adjust the and of the files to be copied.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.SearchCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when an asynchronous search operation completes.
member.remarks: In .NET 4.5 and higher it's recommended to use async and await modifiers for asynchronous operations.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.DeleteDirectory(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the specified directory and, if indicated, any subdirectories and files in the directory.
member.param: The path and name of the directory to remove. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are deleted. For example, if ""(empty string) is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be deleted. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the .TXT extension will be deleted. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, or VB extension in "/mydir" will be deleted. If no masks specified, the whole content of the specified directory should be deleted. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
true to remove directories, subdirectories, and files in path; otherwise, false.

remarks.p: Empty directories are to be removed. This method does not build directory hierarchy before deleting items.
For more advanced files and directories deletion, use the methods.

member.returns: The statistics of the multi-file operation.
member.exception: is a null reference (Nothing in VB.NET).
contains illegal path characters.
An error occurred while deleting the directory.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.Delete(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition)
member.summary: Deletes files or directories and, if indicated, any subdirectories matching the specified search condition on the list.
member.param: List of files and directories to remove. This list can contain and objects. (e.g. (new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" }...) or (new object[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }...)) This parameter cannot be null or empty.
true to remove subdirectories, and files in path; otherwise, false to remove files in the first level directory only.
true to remove empty directories; otherwise, false.
The search conditions to match against the files, or a null reference to search for all files.
member.returns: A that contains the statistics of the operation and list of processed files and directories.
member.remarks: This method does not build directory hierarchy before deleting items.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.Delete(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition)
member.summary: Deletes files and directories matching the specified search condition in the specified directory. This method only deletes the items in the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To remove the whole directory, you should add a directory separator character at the end of that parameter.
member.param: The path and name of the directory containing contents to remove. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are deleted. For example, if ""(empty string) is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be deleted. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the .TXT extension will be deleted. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, or VB extension in "/mydir" will be deleted. If no masks specified, files and subdirectories in the specified directory should be deleted. The final search condition is a combination of the masks, if found, in the and the parameters. If this value ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the containing directory will also be removed. For example, if "/folder/" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" folder and itself will be removed. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
true to remove subdirectories, and files in path; otherwise, false to remove files in the first level directory only.
true to remove empty directories; otherwise, false.
The search conditions to match against the files, or a null reference to search for all files.
member.returns: A that contains the statistics of the operation and list of processed files and directories.
member.remarks: Empty directories are to be removed. This method does not build directory hierarchy before deleting items.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.Delete(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition)
member.summary: Deletes files matching the specified search condition in the specified directory. This method only deletes the items in the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To remove the whole directory, you should add a directory separator character at the end of that parameter.
member.param: The path and name of the directory containing contents to remove. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are deleted. For example, if ""(empty string) is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be deleted. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the .TXT extension will be deleted. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, or VB extension in "/mydir" will be deleted. If no masks specified, files and subdirectories in the specified directory should be deleted. The final search condition is a combination of the masks, if found, in the and the parameters. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory in the parameter should also be deleted. For example: ("/MyDir/*.txt", ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is also deleted if this folder is empty after all ".txt" files within "MyDir" have been deleted; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not included in the deletion process.

List of files and directories to remove. This list may contain and objects. (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 })
true to build directory hierarchy to show progress of the entire operation before deleting; otherwise, false.
true to remove subdirectories, and files in path; otherwise, false to remove files in the first level directory only.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.Delete(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean,ComponentPro.IO.MultiFileOperationOptions)
member.summary: Deletes files or directories in the specified directory. This method only deletes the items in the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To remove the whole directory, you should add a directory separator character at the end of that parameter.
member.param: The path and name of the directory containing contents to remove. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are deleted. For example, if ""(empty string) is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be deleted. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the .TXT extension will be deleted. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, or VB extension in "/mydir" will be deleted. If no masks specified, files and subdirectories in the specified directory should be deleted. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. If this value ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the containing directory is to be removed. For example, if "/folder/" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" folder and itself are removed. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory in the parameter should also be deleted. For example: ("/MyDir/*.txt", ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is also deleted if this folder is empty after all ".txt" files within "MyDir" have been deleted; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not included in the deletion process.
The delete options.

List of files and directories to remove. This optional list can contain and objects. (e.g. ("", false, new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" }...) or ("", false, new object[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }...)).
true to remove empty directories; otherwise, false.
member.returns: A that contains the statistics of the operation and list of processed files and directories.

For example: TransferFilesAsync(ftpSys, "/MyDir", null, zipSys, "/ZipDir", ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "ZipDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "ZipDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir".

A list of files to transfer, or a null reference to transfer files specified by the parameter. This list must comprise file paths in and/or instances. (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 })
The destination file system.
The path of the destination directory which will receive files from the source file system.
Specifies options for the transfer. It determines how files will be transferred.
member.returns: A that contains the statistics of the operation and list of processed files and directories or null if this item is not a directory.

members.member:
Moves files that match the search condition specified in the parameter from the specified directory to the destination directory using multiple threads. This method only moves the items of the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To move the whole directory, use the method instead.
The path of the directory containing files and subdirectories to move. If it is empty, the current directory path of the file system is used. When the parameter is a null reference, this can contain wildcard masks. For example, "/myremotedir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" means all .dat, .cs, and .vb files in '/myremotedir' will be moved, "/myremotedir" means all files in '/myremotedir' will be moved. For more details, see and the option . The list of file names or objects containing information of files to move (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }), or a null reference to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the options parameter. If this value ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the containing directory will also be moved. For example, if "/folder/" is used, files and subdirectories of "folder" directory and itself will be moved; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. The path of the destination directory. The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process. The number of concurrent threads used to transfer/move files, or 0 to transfer/move files in single-thread mode. A boolean value indicating whether the method will block the execution until all threads have finished. This parameter is only used when the parameter is greater than 0. A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.Move(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves files on the list that match the search condition specified in the parameter to the destination directory using multiple threads. This method only moves the items of the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To move the whole directory, use the method instead.
member.param: The list of file names or objects containing information of files to move. (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 })
The path of the destination directory.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method blocks the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method immediately returns the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

members.member:
Moves files that match the search condition specified in the parameter from the specified directory to the destination directory using multiple threads. This method only moves the items of the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To move the whole directory, use the method instead.
The path of the directory containing files and subdirectories to move. This can contain wildcard masks. member.summary: Asynchronously deletes files matching the specified search condition in the specified directory. This method only deletes the items in the specified directory if the parameter does not end with a directory separator (e.g. '/' or '\'). To remove the whole directory, you should add a directory separator character at the end of that parameter.
member.param: The base directory to search for files and directories to remove.
true to search for files, directories, and subdirectories in ; otherwise, false to search for files only.

A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: Empty directories are to be removed. This method does not build directory hierarchy before deleting items.
member.returns: An object that references the asynchronous operation.

member.param: The base directory to search for files and directories to remove or null when is specified and a base path for the list is not needed.

Indicates whether the containing directory in the parameter should also be deleted. For example: DeleteAsync("/MyDir/*.txt", ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is also deleted if this folder is empty after all ".txt" files within "MyDir" have been deleted; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not included in the deletion process.
List of files and directories to remove. This list must comprise file paths in and/or instances.
true to build directory hierarchy to show progress of the entire operation before deleting; otherwise, false.
true to include files and subdirectories; false to include files in the specified directory only.
true to remove empty directories; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.NormalizePath(System.String)
member.summary: Normalizes a path. This method normalizes path like "\my folder\\my sub folder/sub folder/\my file" to "/my folder/my sub folder/sub folder/my file" if directory separator character is '/'.
member.param: The path to normalize.
member.returns: Normalized path.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.NormalizePath(System.String,System.Boolean,ComponentPro.OptionValue,ComponentPro.OptionValue)
member.summary: Normalizes a path. This method normalizes path like "\my folder\\my sub folder/sub folder/\my file" to "/my folder/my sub folder/sub folder/my file" if directory separator character is '/'.
member.param: The path to normalize.
A boolean value indicating whether to normalize special directories like '.' and '..' found in the path. It treats '.' dir as the current directory and '..' as the upper directory.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the end of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the ending separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the last character as it is.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the beginning of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the leading separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the first character as it is.
member.returns: Normalized path.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.NormalizePath(System.String,System.Char[],System.Boolean,ComponentPro.OptionValue,ComponentPro.OptionValue)
member.summary: Normalizes a path. This method normalizes path like "\my folder\\my sub folder/sub folder/\my file" to "/my folder/my sub folder/sub folder/my file" if directory separator characters are '/' and '\' respectively.
member.param: The path to normalize.

The path separator characters (e.g. '/' and '\' characters). The first separator in the list will be used to construct the final path. Remote file systems (e.g. Ftp, Sftp, Scp, etc.) usually use '/' character as the first separator.
A boolean value indicating whether to normalize special directories like '.' and '..' found in the path. It treats '.' dir as the current directory and '..' as the upper directory.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the end of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the ending separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the last character as it is.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the beginning of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the leading separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the first character as it is.
member.returns: Normalized path.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.ProgressInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the interval in milliseconds between the events fired during transfer. The default value is 100 ms.
member.remarks: If set to zero(0), the event is fired for every data block transferred. In GUI applications, displaying a progress bar and messages too many times may affect the application performance. Increase this property to avoid that.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.ServerTimeZoneOffset
member.summary: This value is used to synchronize the CreationTime and LastWriteTime of files after a transfer. The default value is TimeSpan.Zero.
member.remarks: When a file is copied from this file system to another one and the option is enabled, the file's and will be added with this value. Likewise, and of a file that is copied from another file system will be subtracted from this value.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.RestoreFileProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to restore file properties including and after downloading or uploading if possible.
member.remarks: Use the to adjust the and of the files to be copied.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.TraceSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the source object for all log messages generated by this object. If not set, the property returns the current object.
member.remarks: It is handy to set this property to a different object other than this object in some situation where all log messages should come from a single source. For example, in a build system, uploading files is just a child task of a main one, by assigning this property to the main task, you can categorize all messages that come from the main task.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.TraceListenerManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the object to which the log messages generated by this object are sent. If not set, the trace listener manager is used. If this property is set to null, all messages from this object wont be logged.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.IO.TimeResolution
member.summary: Specifies the time resolutions used for comparisons.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TimeResolution.None
member.summary: Time is taken as is.
member.remarks: Useful when working with NTFS file system.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TimeResolution.Seconds
member.summary: The smallest time unit for comparisons is one second. Milliseconds are ignored. E.g. 11:33:55.999 is rounded to 11:33:55.000.
member.remarks: Useful when working with some UNIX FTP or SFTP servers.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TimeResolution.TwoSeconds
member.summary: The smallest time unit for comparisons is two seconds. So odd seconds are rounded to lower even value; milliseconds are ignored. E.g. 11:33:55.999 is rounded to 11:33:54.000.
member.remarks: Useful when working with FAT file system (.NET CF, MS-DOS).

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TimeResolution.Minutes
member.summary: The smallest time unit for comparisons is one minute. Seconds are ignored. E.g. 11:33:55.234 is rounded to 11:33.
member.remarks: Useful when working with some UNIX FTP or SFTP servers.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TimeResolution.Days
member.summary: The smallest time unit for comparisons is one day. Time component is ignored. E.g. 2012-12-12 11:33:55.999 is rounded to 2012-12-12 00:00:00.000.
member.remarks: Useful when working with some UNIX FTP or SFTP servers.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.MultiFileOperationOptions.BuildDirectoryTree
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to retrieve directory structure before the multi-file operation (e.g. transferring or deleting multiple files and directories).
member.remarks: Setting this option to true makes , , , and available when handling the event. The directory structure information retrieval may take time.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.MultiFileOperationOptions.RetainFileList
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to retain the list while executing the multi-file operation and after it completes, making it possible to access information of all processed files and directories.
member.value: true to retain the list; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: By default, this property is false to minimize memory footprint while executing the operation. By setting this property to true, the operation will need some extra memory. When processing many files (i.e. 100k files), you may want to leave this property as default (false) to reduce the memory needed to store the list.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.MultiFileOperationOptions.SearchConditionCombinedWithMasksInSourcePath
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to combine (AND logical operator) the wildcard masks found in the source path method parameter with the property in this transfer option object.

remarks.p: If the source path does not contain wildcard masks, this field is ignored.

If the source path contains wildcard masks, and this field is set to true, then the AND logical operator is used; otherwise, if this field is set to false, the OR logical operator is used. For example, in a call to the , you specify "C:\temp\*.tmp" as the source path and your is (.Hidden). If this field is true, the will search for all hidden files with .tmp extensions; false means the will search for files with .tmp extensions or with hidden attributes.

member.value: The default value is true.

This option is not used when is false or does not include . e.g., if the indicates that 'bin' and 'obj' folders are excluded, this option is true and is Any, items in 'bin' and 'obj' are still returned; otherwise, items in these folders are not returned.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.UploadAsync(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if ""(empty string) is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the .TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the .DAT, .CS, or .VB extension in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and parameters of the parameter. If this value ends with a directory separator like '/' or '\', the containing directory is to be uploaded. For example, if "/folder/" is used, files and subdirectories of "folder" directory and itself are uploaded; the destination directory contains "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.UploadAsync(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Object)

member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and parameters of the parameter. If this value ends with a directory separator like '/' or '\', the containing directory is to be uploaded. For example, if "/folder/" is used, files and subdirectories of "folder" directory and itself are uploaded; the destination directory contains "folder" directory and its contents. member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.UploadAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is a null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if ""(empty string) is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the .TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the .DAT, .CS, or .VB extension in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadAsync("MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or a null reference to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadAsync(null, false, new string[] {@"d:\file1", @"c:\folder\file2", @"d:\dir1" }, ...) or UploadAsync(null, false, new object[] {@"d:\temp\file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.UploadAsync(ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified source directory on the specified source file system that match the search condition specified in the options parameter to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The source file system containing files to upload.

The path of the source directory on the source file system to upload files to the remote server. If it is empty, the current directory path of the file system is used. If it's null, must be specified. When the parameter is a null reference, This can contain wildcard masks. For example, "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" means all .dat, .cs, and .vb files in 'c:\mydir' will be uploaded, "c:\mydir" means all files in 'c:\mydir' will be uploaded. For more details, see and the option .

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadAsync("MyDir/*.txt", true, "/RemoteDir", true) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or a null reference to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This list must comprise file paths in and/or instances. (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 })
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An object that references the asynchronous operation.

For example, "/myremotedir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" means all .dat, .cs, and .vb files in '/myremotedir' will be downloaded, "/myremotedir" means all files in '/myremotedir' will be downloaded. For more details, see and the option .

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: Download("/MyDir/*.txt", true, null, zipSystem, "/ZipDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "ZipDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "ZipDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir".

The list of files or directories to download. This list must comprise file paths in and/or instances. (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }). This can be null.
The destination system that receives the files from the remote server.
The path of the destination directory to receive files from the remote server.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An object that references the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Downloads files from the specified remote directory that match the search condition specified in the options parameter to the destination directory using multiple threads.
member.param: The path of the remote directory containing files and subdirectories to download. If it is empty, the current directory path of the file system is used. When the parameter is a null reference, this can contain wildcard masks. For example, "/myremotedir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" means all .dat, .cs, and .vb files in '/myremotedir' will be downloaded, "/myremotedir" means all files in '/myremotedir' will be downloaded. For more details, see and the option .

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: Download("/MyDir/*.txt", true, null, zipSystem, "/ZipDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "ZipDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "ZipDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir".
The list of objects containing information of files to download, or a null reference to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the options parameter.
The destination system that receives the files from the remote server.
The path of the destination directory to receive files from the remote server.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method blocks the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method immediately returns the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.summary: Uploads files from the specified source directory on the specified source file system that match the search condition specified in the options parameter to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The source file system containing files to upload.

The path of the source directory on the source file system to upload files to the remote server. If it is empty, the current directory path of the file system is used. When the parameter is a null reference, This can contain wildcard masks. For example, "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" means all .dat, .cs, and .vb files in 'c:\mydir' will be uploaded, "c:\mydir" means all files in 'c:\mydir' will be uploaded. For more details, see and the option .

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadAsync("MyDir/*.txt", true, "/RemoteDir", true) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".
The list of objects containing information of files to upload, or a null reference to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the options parameter.
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, indicating after what period an operation (sending commands, waiting for responses or time between data buffer transfers) should timeout.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to 60000 (60 seconds). Minimal value is 1000. A value of -1 or 0 indicates that there is no timeout - the library will wait until a corresponding response is received or the request is canceled.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the Encoding used to encode and decode command parameters and server responses.
member.value: The Encoding used to encode and decode command parameters and server responses. Default is Encoding.Default.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.PathNormalization
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to normalize path before any file or directory operation.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.AsciiFileSearchConditions
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of ASCII file extensions.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.ReconnectionMaxRetries
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of retries for reconnection.
member.remarks: By default, this value is 0 (the library does not try to reconnect to the server when the connection is lost). When the connection is lost, the component will try to reconnect to the server. If the number of retries exceeds this value, the class will report the connection error.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.ReconnectionFailureDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay in milliseconds between failed login attempts for reconnection during a multi-file operation.
member.remarks: By default, this value is 5000 (5 secs). When the connection is lost, the component will try to reconnect to the server. If the number of retries exceeds the , the class will report the connection error.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.StateChanged

member.name: E:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.ReconnectionErrorChecking

member.remarks: This event is fired when the method is called.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.Reconnecting

member.name: E:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.Reconnected
member.summary: Occurs when the file system has encountered an error and has reconnected to the server successfully.

member.value: true if the client has tried and failed to reconnect to the server with the number of retries specified in ; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition.IncludeMasks(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified filtering path or mask to use to scan file path or names to the inclusion patterns.
member.param: Filtering path, relative to a base path, or mask to use to scan file path or names. This parameter can contain a combination of valid literal path, directory separators, and wildcard (* and ?) characters (see Remarks), but doesn't support regular expressions. (e.g. "*.txt", "a??.txt", "*.txt;*.doc", "a\*\b\*.exe|*.dll", "a\**\b\*.cs"...). File name masks are delimited by ',', '|', and ';' characters. If pattern ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the whole pattern without that character is used as a directory path masks.
member.returns: A .
member.remarks:
can be a combination of literal, directory separators, and wildcard characters, but doesn't support regular expressions. The following wildcard specifiers are permitted in .
Wildcard specifierMatches
? (question mark)Zero or one character in that position.
e.g. "?a" matches "1a" and also "ba" but not "1a2".
* (asterisk)Zero or more characters in that position except the directory separators (usually '/' or '\' character).
e.g. "*a" matches "a" and also "ba" but not "123".
** (double asterisks)Zero or one character in that position. Directory separators are accepted.
e.g. "a\**\b" matches "a\1\2\z\b" and also "a\b" but not "ab". "a\**\**\b" pattern is equivalent to "a\**\b".
Some pattern examples:
PatternDescription
content\text??.docMatches files (e.g. "text12.doc" or "textab.doc", but not "textabc.doc") within "content" directory.
content\*.docMatches all files (e.g. "text12.doc" or "textabc123.doc", but not "textabc.docx") within "content" directory.
content\**\*.docMatches all ".doc" files found in all subdirectories of "content" directory. e.g. "content\a\text.doc", "content\a\text2.doc", or "content\a\c\chapter.doc", but not "content\text.doc" or "content2\text.doc".
content\**.docMatches all ".doc" files found in "content" directory and all of its subdirectories. e.g. "content\text.doc", "content\a\text.doc", "content\a\text2.doc", or "content\a\c\chapter.doc", but not "content2\text.doc".
content\data*\day??>This pattern ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\'. Matches all files found in directories with paths that match "content\data*\day??" pattern. e.g. "content\data\day12\text.doc", or "content\data2\day11\text.doc", but not "content\data\text.doc".

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition.IncludeMasks(System.String,ComponentPro.IO.SearchConditionFileTypes)
member.summary: Adds the specified filtering path or mask to use to scan file path or names to the inclusion patterns.
member.param: Filtering path, relative to a base path, or mask to use to scan file path or names. If pattern ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the whole pattern without that character is used as a directory path masks.
Determines whether the condition applies to files, folders or both.
member.returns: A .
member.remarks:
can be a combination of literal, directory separators, and wildcard characters, but doesn't support regular expressions. The following wildcard specifiers are permitted in .
Wildcard specifierMatches

* (asterisk)Zero or more characters in that position except the directory separators (usually '/' or '\' character).
e.g. "*a" matches "a" and also "ba" but not "123".
** (double asterisks)Zero or one character in that position.
e.g. "a\**\b" matches "a\1\2\z\b" and also "a\b" but not "ab". "a\**\**\b" pattern is equivalent to "a\**\b".
Some pattern examples:
PatternDescription
content\text??.docMatches files (e.g. "text12.doc" or "textab.doc", but not "textabc.doc") within "content" directory.
content\*.docMatches all files (e.g. "text12.doc" or "textabc123.doc", but not "textabc.docx") within "content" directory.
content\**\*.docMatches all ".doc" files found in all subdirectories of "content" directory. e.g. "content\a\text.doc", "content\a\text2.doc", or "content\a\c\chapter.doc", but not "content\text.doc" or "content2\text.doc".
content\**.docMatches all ".doc" files found in "content" directory and all of its subdirectories. e.g. "content\text.doc", "content\a\text.doc", "content\a\text2.doc", "content\a\c\chapter.doc", but not "content2\text.doc".
content\data*\day??>Matches all files found in directories with paths that match "content\data*\day??" pattern. e.g. "content\data\day12\text.doc", or "content\data2\day11\text.doc", but not "content\data\text.doc".

e.g. "*a" matches "a" and also "ba" but not "123".
** (double asterisks)Zero or one character in that position.
e.g. "a\**\b" matches "a\1\2\z\b" and also "a\b" but not "ab". "a\**\**\b" pattern is equivalent to "a\**\b".

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition.ExcludeMasks(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified filtering path or mask to use to scan file path or names to the exclusion patterns.
member.param: Filtering path, relative to a base path, or mask to use to scan file path or names. This parameter can contain a combination of valid literal path, directory separators, and wildcard (* and ?) characters (see Remarks), but doesn't support regular expressions. (e.g. "*.txt", "a??.txt", "*.txt;*.doc", "a\*\b\*.exe|*.dll", "a\**\b\*.cs"...). File name masks are delimited by ',', '|', and ';' characters. If pattern ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the whole pattern without that character is used as a directory path masks.
member.returns: A .
member.remarks:
can be a combination of literal, directory separators, and wildcard characters, but doesn't support regular expressions. The following wildcard specifiers are permitted in .
Wildcard specifierMatches
? (question mark)Zero or one character in that position.
e.g. "?a" matches "1a" and also "ba" but not "1a2".
* (asterisk)Zero or more characters in that position except the directory separators (usually '/' or '\' character).
e.g. "*a" matches "a" and also "ba" but not "123".
** (double asterisks)Zero or one character in that position.
e.g. "a\**\b" matches "a\1\2\z\b" and also "a\b" but not "ab". "a\**\**\b" pattern is equivalent to "a\**\b".
Some pattern examples:
PatternDescription
content\text??.docMatches files (e.g. "text12.doc" or "textab.doc", but not "textabc.doc") within "content" directory.
content\*.docMatches all files (e.g. "text12.doc" or "textabc123.doc", but not "textabc.docx") within "content" directory.
content\**\*.docMatches all ".doc" files found in all subdirectories of "content" directory. e.g. "content\a\text.doc", "content\a\text2.doc", or "content\a\c\chapter.doc", but not "content\text.doc" or "content2\text.doc".
content\**.docMatches all ".doc" files found in "content" directory and all of its subdirectories. e.g. "content\text.doc", "content\a\text.doc", "content\a\text2.doc", "content\a\c\chapter.doc", but not "content2\text.doc".
content\data*\day??>Matches all files found in directories with paths that match "content\data*\day??" pattern. e.g. "content\data\day12\text.doc", or "content\data2\day11\text.doc", but not "content\data\text.doc".

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition.ExcludeMasks(System.String,ComponentPro.IO.SearchConditionFileTypes)
member.summary: Adds the specified filtering path or mask to use to scan file path or names to the exclusion patterns.
member.param: Filtering path, relative to a base path, or mask to use to scan file path or names. This parameter can contain a combination of valid literal path, directory separators, and wildcard (* and ?) characters (see Remarks), but doesn't support regular expressions. (e.g. "*.txt", "a??.txt", "*.txt;*.doc", "a\*\b\*.exe|*.dll", "a\**\b\*.cs"...). File name masks are delimited by ',', '|', and ';' characters. If pattern ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the whole pattern without that character is used as a directory path masks.
Determines whether the condition applies to files, folders or both.
member.returns: A .
member.remarks:
can be a combination of literal, directory separators, and wildcard characters, but doesn't support regular expressions. The following wildcard specifiers are permitted in .
Wildcard specifierMatches
? (question mark)Zero or one character in that position.
e.g. "?a" matches "1a" and also "ba" but not "1a2".
* (asterisk)Zero or more characters in that position except the directory separators (usually '/' or '\' character).
e.g. "*a" matches "a" and also "ba" but not "123".
** (double asterisks)Zero or one character in that position.
e.g. "a\**\b" matches "a\1\2\z\b" and also "a\b" but not "ab". "a\**\**\b" pattern is equivalent to "a\**\b".
Some pattern examples:
PatternDescription
content\text??.docMatches files (e.g. "text12.doc" or "textab.doc", but not "textabc.doc") within "content" directory.
content\*.docMatches all files (e.g. "text12.doc" or "textabc123.doc", but not "textabc.docx") within "content" directory.
content\*\*.docMatches all ".doc" files within "content" directory's first level subdirectories. e.g. "content\a\text.doc", "content\a\text2.doc", or "content\a\chapter.doc", but not "content\text.doc" or "content\a\b\text.doc".
content\**\*.docMatches all ".doc" files found in all subdirectories of "content" directory. e.g. "content\a\text.doc", "content\a\text2.doc", or "content\a\c\chapter.doc", but not "content\text.doc" or "content2\text.doc".
content\**.docMatches all ".doc" files found in "content" directory and all of its subdirectories. e.g. "content\text.doc", "content\a\text.doc", "content\a\text2.doc", "content\a\c\chapter.doc", but not "content2\text.doc".
content\data*\day??>Matches all files found in directories with paths that match "content\data*\day??" pattern. e.g. "content\data\day12\text.doc", or "content\data2\day11\text.doc", but not "content\data\text.doc".

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.DiskFileSystem.NormalizePath(System.String,System.Char[],System.Boolean,ComponentPro.OptionValue,ComponentPro.OptionValue)
member.summary: Normalizes a path. This method normalizes path like "\my folder\\my sub folder/sub folder/\my file" to "/my folder/my sub folder/sub folder/my file" if directory separator characters are '/' and '\' respectively.
member.param: The path to normalize.

The path separator characters (e.g. '/' and '\' characters). The first separator in the list will be used to construct the final path. Remote file systems (e.g. Ftp, Sftp, Scp, etc.) usually use '/' character as the first separator.
A boolean value indicating whether to normalize special directories like '.' and '..' found in the path. It treats '.' dir as the current directory and '..' as the upper directory.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the end of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the ending separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the last character as it is.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the beginning of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the leading separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the first character as it is.
member.returns: Normalized path.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.IO.NameRegexSearchCondition
member.summary: Search for files that match the specified filemasks in name.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.NameRegexSearchCondition.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified regex pattern. This will search for both file and symlink.
member.param: The regular expression pattern to match against filename, or a null reference to match all items.

The path mask used to scan file paths (e.g. "a/*/b", "a/**/b/c?", or "" - use '*' to match any character in that position except directory separators, '**' to match any character in that position including directory separators). An empty path mask string "" represents the top-level directory. e.g. The following example illustrates how to search for all .sln files in D:\Test\Samples\<any>\CS: DiskFileSystem.Default.Search(@"D:\Test", true, SearchConditionFileTypes.File, new NameSearchCondition(new string[] { "*.sln" }, new string[] {@"Samples\*\CS"}, true, SearchConditionFileTypes.File), null)

The file types to search.

The path mask used to scan file paths (e.g. "a/*/b", "a/**/b/c?", or "" - use '*' to match any character in that position except directory separators, '**' to match any character in that position including directory separators). An empty path mask string "" represents the top-level directory. e.g. The following example illustrates how to search for all .sln files in D:\Test\Samples\<any>\CS: DiskFileSystem.Default.Search(@"D:\Test", true, SearchConditionFileTypes.File, new NameSearchCondition(new string[] { "*.sln" }, new string[] {@"Samples\*\CS"}, true, SearchConditionFileTypes.File), null)

member.name: T:ComponentPro.IO.NameSearchCondition
member.summary: Filters a object based on its name.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.NameSearchCondition.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified filemasks. This will search for both file and symlink.
member.param: Filtering path, relative to a base path, or mask to use to scan file path or names. This parameter can contain a combination of valid literal path, directory separators, and wildcard (* and ?) characters (see Remarks), but doesn't support regular expressions. (e.g. "*.txt", "a??.txt", "*.txt;*.doc", "a\*\b\*.exe|*.dll", "a\**\b\*.cs"...). File name masks are delimited by ',', '|', and ';' characters. If pattern ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the whole pattern without that character is used as a directory path masks. If patterns is a null reference (Nothing in VB.NET) or empty, always returns true.
member.remarks: To include search pattern for Directory type, use the constructor.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.NameSearchCondition.ToString
member.summary: Converts the object to string.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.NameSearchCondition.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified filemasks. This will search for both file and symlink. To include Directory search type, use or .
member.param: Filtering path, relative to a base path, or mask to use to scan file path or names. This parameter can contain a combination of valid literal path, directory separators, and wildcard (* and ?) characters (see Remarks), but doesn't support regular expressions. (e.g. "*.txt", "a??.txt", "*.txt;*.doc", "a\*\b\*.exe|*.dll", "a\**\b\*.cs"...). File name masks are delimited by ',', '|', and ';' characters. If the parameter starts with ':', the search will be case sensitive. If pattern ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the whole pattern without that character is used as a directory path masks. If patterns is a null reference (Nothing in VB.NET) or empty, always returns true.
A boolean value indicating to ignore case when comparing file names and/or paths.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.NameSearchCondition.#ctor(System.String,ComponentPro.IO.SearchConditionFileTypes)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified pattern.
member.param: Filtering path, relative to a base path, or mask to use to scan file path or names. This parameter can contain a combination of valid literal path, directory separators, and wildcard (* and ?) characters (see Remarks), but doesn't support regular expressions. (e.g. "*.txt", "a??.txt", "*.txt;*.doc", "a\*\b\*.exe|*.dll", "a\**\b\*.cs"...). File name masks are delimited by ',', '|', and ';' characters. If the fileMasks parameter starts with ':', the search will be case sensitive. If pattern ends with a directory separator character like '/' or '\', the whole pattern without that character is used as a directory path masks. If patterns is a null reference (Nothing in VB.NET) or empty, always returns true.
Determines whether the condition applies to files, folders or both.
member.exception: is empty or contains one or more directory separator characters.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.NameSearchCondition.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,ComponentPro.IO.SearchConditionFileTypes)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified filemasks and directory path masks.
member.param: The mask used to scan file names (e.g. "*.txt", "a??.txt", "*.txt;*.doc", "*.exe|*.dll" ...).

The path mask used to scan file paths (e.g. "a/*/b", "a/**/b/c?", or "" - use '*' to match any character in that position except directory separators, '**' to match any character in that position including directory separators). An empty path mask string "" represents the top-level directory. e.g. The following example illustrates how to search for all .sln files in D:\Test\Samples\<any>\CS: DiskFileSystem.Default.Search(@"D:\Test", true, SearchConditionFileTypes.File, new NameSearchCondition(new string[] { "*.sln" }, new string[] {@"Samples\*\CS"}, true, SearchConditionFileTypes.File), null)
Determines whether the condition applies to files, folders or both.
A boolean value indicating to ignore case when comparing file names and paths.
