member.name: T:ComponentPro.IO.QuickSyncOptions
member.summary: Provides advanced options for the and methods.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.QuickSyncOptions.Clone
member.summary: Creates a shallow copy of this option object.
member.returns: The cloned object.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.QuickSyncOptions.Comparer
member.summary: Gets or sets the file comparison method. The default value is . The component invokes the comparer specified by this property when existing files with the same name found on both source and destination file systems. When the result returned by the comparer is not Equal, file on the source or destination file system will be updated depending on the synchronization direction. If it's Resumable, the library will resume transfer by appending the missing data to the end of the target file.
member.remarks: You can use '|' and '+' (OR and AND) operators to make your own comparer. e.g. FileComparers.FileNameComparer + FileComparers.FileContentComparerWithResumabilityCheck to compare file name and file content with resumability check.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.QuickSyncOptions.AllowDeletion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow file and directory deletion. Default value is true.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.QuickSyncOptions.AllowCreation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow file and directory creation. Default value is true.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.QuickSyncOptions.AllowResuming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow file transfer resumption. Default value is false.
member.remarks: When this property is true and the comparison result of the source and dest files is Resumable, the target file will be resumed. If the result is NotEqual the target file will be re-created and copied from the source one. If the result is Equal the target file is ignored. Only and comparers have the capability to check for resumability. If they dont fit your requirements, you can write your own class inheriting and override the method to do your own check.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.QuickSyncOptions.Recursive
member.summary: Indicates whether the library will search for files in the first level directory and all its subdirectories. Default value is true.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.QuickSyncOptions.SearchCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the search conditions to match against the files. The default value is null reference; equivalent to '*.*' file mask.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemPath.NormalizePath(System.String,System.Char[])
member.summary: Normalizes a path. This method normalizes path like "\my folder\\my sub folder/sub folder/\my file" to "/my folder/my sub folder/sub folder/my file" if directory separator characters are '/' and '\' respectively.
member.param: The path to normalize.

The path separator characters (e.g. '/' and '\' characters). The first separator in the list will be used to construct the final path. Remote file systems (e.g. Ftp, Sftp, Scp, etc.) usually use '/' character as the first separator.
member.returns: Normalized path.
member.remarks: Separator at the beginning or end of the path will not be removed. Special dirs will not be normalized.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemPath.NormalizePath(System.String,System.Char[],System.Boolean,ComponentPro.OptionValue,ComponentPro.OptionValue)
member.summary: Normalizes a path. This method normalizes path like "\my folder\\my sub folder/sub folder/\my file" to "/my folder/my sub folder/sub folder/my file" if directory separator characters are '/' and '\' respectively.
member.param: The path to normalize.

The path separator characters (e.g. '/' and '\' characters). The first separator in the list will be used to construct the final path. Remote file systems (e.g. Ftp, Sftp, Scp, etc.) usually use '/' character as the first separator.
A boolean value indicating whether to normalize special directories like '.' and '..' found in the path. It treats '.' dir as the current directory and '..' as the upper directory.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the end of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the ending separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the last character as it is.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the beginning of the path is to be removed if present. Yes - to always include the leading separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the first character as it is.
member.returns: Normalized path.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.FollowLink
member.summary: Resolve and process the symbolic link.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.Overwrite
member.summary: Overwrite target file with the same name.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.OverwriteFilesWithDifferentSizes
member.summary: Overwrite target file with the same name if it has a different size.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.OverwriteOlderFiles
member.summary: Overwrite target file with the same name if it is older than the source file. It is not recommended to use this action for remote file systems because modification dates are often misreported by SFTP and FTP servers. Instead, please select other action or handle the event and choose either Overwrite or Skip action instead.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.Rename
member.summary: Use different name specified in the property as the new destination name. The desired name must be set using the property and it must not be empty or a null reference.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.Retry
member.summary: Retry the current operation.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.Skip
member.summary: Skip the current item. No actions will be performed on it.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel the whole multi-file transfer and raise an exception. No other files will be transferred.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.ResumeFileTransfer
member.summary: Resume file transfer.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.OverwriteFilesWithDifferentChecksums
member.summary: Overwrite target file with the same name if it has a different checksum. Only some remote FTP and SFTP support this option. ZIP, MemoryFileSystem and DiskFileSystem always support this option.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.IO.TransferFileOverwriteCondition

member.summary: Overwrite the existing file without any conditions.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferFileOverwriteCondition.SizeDiffers
member.summary: Overwrite the existing file if its size differs from the source one's.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferFileOverwriteCondition.Older
member.summary: Overwrite the existing file if its last write time is older than the source one's. It is not recommended to use this action for remote file systems because modification dates are often misreported by SFTP and FTP servers.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferFileOverwriteCondition.ChecksumDiffers
member.summary: Overwrite the existing file if its checksum differs from the source one's.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.Clone
member.summary: Creates a shallow copy of this option object.
member.returns: The cloned object.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.Flatten
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to copy files to the destination base directory, without persisting the directory structure of the source files. For example: if "Dir1/File1.dat" and "Dir2/File2.dat" are the source files and "/RemoteDir" on an FTP server is the destination base directory, "File1.dat" and "File2.dat" are uploaded to "/RemoteDir" and remote folder "Dir1" and "Dir2" are not created.
member.value: true if flatten the output; false otherwise.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.RecheckItemExistence
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to force checking whether the currently processing item still exists. If not, the event is raised.
member.remarks: For example: If file "file1.dat" exists at the beginning of a multi-file transfer. However, for some reason, it's deleted by another program before transferring. The multi-file operation re-checks if the file still exists. If not it will be marked as skipped if this property is true, otherwise an error is thrown.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.CreateEmptyDirectories
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to allow copying empty directories from the source file system to the destination file system. The default value is - the component automatically determines whether to create new empty directories. For example, if the files to transfer are limited by a search pattern "*.cs", only the folders that have files with the ".cs" extension are created. value indicates that directories are always created on the target system regardless whether they are empty or containing contents; value indicates that empty directories will not be created on the target system.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.FileOverwriteMode
member.summary: Specifies action taken when the destination file already exists. The default value is . For example, if is used, existing files with the same names and different size will be overwritten.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.Comparer
member.summary: Specifies a custom file comparer used to compare source and destination files to determine whether to overwrite an existing target file. It can only be used when the property of a transfer option object was set to .

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.PreferredChecksumType
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred checksum type used to compare checksums of a source file with a destination file when a target file with the same name exists.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.AutoSelectFallbackChecksumAlgorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to automatically select the best checksum algorithm when the algorithm is not available for either source or destination file system.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.TimeResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which specifies granularity for time comparisons if the property is .

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.RenamingPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern that is used to rename existing files if is set to . When this property is a null reference and the is set to , the value "{name}({num}).{ext}" is used as the new name pattern. In the pattern, "{name}" represents name of file (e.g. "My file"), "{ext}" represents extensions of file (e.g. ".dat") and "{num}" represents an incremental number.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.MoveFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to move files from the source directory to the destination directory.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions.DeleteEmptyDirectories
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to delete empty directories when moving or transferring files and directories with option enabled. The default value is true - empty directories are to be removed.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.TransferQueue.TraceSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the source object for all log messages generated by this object. If not set, the property returns the current object.
member.remarks: It is handy to set this property to a different object other than this object in some situation where all log messages should come from a single source. For example, in a build system, uploading files is just a child task of a main one, by assigning this property to the main task, you can categorize all messages that come from the main task.

member.summary: Gets or sets the object to which the log messages generated by this object are sent. If not set, the trace listener manager is used. If this property is set to null, all messages from this object wont be logged.

member.summary: No state spefcified.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.BuildingDirectoryStructure
member.summary: Building directory structure. This state is available when the library is retrieving information of directory structure before transferring or processing the directory contents. When the option of a or instance is set to true, the library retrieves the directory hierarchy before transferring or processing the directory contents.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartCopyingFile
member.summary: The current file is about to be copied.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartUploadingFile
member.summary: A file from another file system or content from a stream is about to upload/copy to the remote server - usually FTP, SFTP, or SCP. This field equals to . When the transfer state is , you can change source file path, destination file path, or skip uploading file in the event handler.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartStoringFile
member.summary: A file from another file system or content from a stream is about to added to this file system - Zip, RealTimeZip, Tar, Tgz, or Gzip. This field equals to . When the transfer state is , you can change source file path, destination file path, or skip storing file in the event handler.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartDownloadingFile
member.summary: A remote file is about to be downloaded to another file system or a stream of data. When the transfer state is , you can change source file path, destination file path, or skip downloading file in the event handler.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartExtractingFile
member.summary: ZIP File system is about to extract a file to another file system or a stream of data. This field equals to . When the transfer state is , you can change source file path, destination file path, or skip extracting file in the event handler.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartComparingFile
member.summary: The current file is about to be compared with another one in a multi-file transfer or synchronization process. This state is available when file comparer, specified in of the class or of the class, is an instance of a class that inherits the class - or . A folder synchronization is initiated by calling the or method.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.MovingItem
member.summary: A file or directory is being moved while moving files on the same system with set to true. When the transfer state is , you can change source file path and destination file path or skip moving the item in the Progress event handler.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.CopyingDirectory
member.summary: A directory is being copied. You can skip copying the directory by setting the property to true or cancel the whole process by calling the methods.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.CreatingDirectory
member.summary: A directory is being created. You cannot change source file path and destination file path. You can only skip creating an empty directory with this transfer state.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.SettingFilePermission
member.summary: Permissions of a file or directory are about to be set.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.SettingFileAttribute
member.summary: Attributes of a file or directory are about to be set.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.Copying
member.summary: The current file is being copied.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.Uploading
member.summary: A file or content from a stream is being uploaded to the remote server - usually FTP, SFTP, or SCP. This field equals to .

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.Storing
member.summary: A file or content from a stream is being stored/added to this file system - usually Zip, RealTimeZip, Tar, Tgz, or Gzip. This field equals to .

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.Downloading

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.Extracting
member.summary: ZIP file system is extracting a file to another file system or a stream of data. This field equals to and .

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.Comparing

This state is available when a file comparer, specified in of the class or of the class, is an instance of a class that inherits the class - usually or . If the transfer state is , the file is being compared with another one in a multi-file transfer or synchronization process. A folder synchronization is initiated by calling the or method.
